TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
On DATE the applicant claimed that he and his children had the exclusive right to lease a flat in PERSON .
On DATE ORG dismissed the action .
On DATE the ORG quashed the first instance judgment .
Since then the proceedings have been pending at first instance . In these proceedings the applicant has been represented by an advocate practising in PERSON .
On DATE the applicant complained about the length of the above proceedings to ORG .

On DATE ORG rejected the complaint as falling short of the formal requirements . The decision states that the applicant failed , despite a warning of DATE , to eliminate formal shortcomings in his submission and to appoint a lawyer representing him before ORG .

On DATE the applicant again filed a constitutional complaint about the length of the proceedings before ORG . In a separate letter dated DATE he requested that ORG should appoint a lawyer to represent him in the proceedings before it . The applicant explained that his only income was an invalidity pension which sufficed just to cover his most urgent needs .

In a letter of DATE a constitutional judge informed the applicant that his new submission was not in conformity with the statutory requirements . The judge noted that the applicant 's information about his income was not certified by the competent authority . Furthermore , in the proceedings before ORG the applicant was represented by an advocate . The constitutional judge 's letter stated that that advocate could also represent the applicant before ORG and that the applicant would have the lawyer 's fees reimbursed in the event that he succeeded in his constitutional complaint . The letter concluded that the applicant 's submission would not be dealt with .
Article CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of the LAW guarantees to everyone the equality of rights .
Article CARDINAL ) of the LAW provides , inter alia , that every person has the right to have his or her case tried without unjustified delay .

Article CARDINAL of the LAW , in effect from DATE , entitles individuals and legal persons to complain about a violation of their fundamental rights and freedoms . Under this provision ORG has the power , in the event that it finds a violation of a person 's fundamental rights , to quash the relevant decision or , where appropriate , to order the authority concerned to proceed with the case without delay . It may also grant adequate financial satisfaction to the person whose constitutional rights have been violated .
Under Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , plaintiffs in proceedings before ORG have to be represented by an advocate .

Section CARDINALa of LAW provides that ORG can , unless otherwise provided by law , apply in an appropriate manner the provisions of LAW and of LAW . Under this provision and the relevant provisions of LAW , it has been the practice of ORG to accede to a plaintiff 's request for an advocate to be appointed to represent him or her where ORG is satisfied that it is justified by the situation of the plaintiff and where the complaint is not clearly devoid of any prospect of success .
